ca.mcgill.ecse211.team4.strategy

Class NavigationStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.team4.strategy.NavigationStrategy

  • public class NavigationStrategy
extends Object
    This class implements a strategy to get to the objective and back to starting point.
    Author:
    Kevin Laframboise

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • navigateToObjectiveZone

        public void navigateToObjectiveZone()
        Uses the navigation strategy dictated by team color to navigate to the objective.

      • navigateBack

        public void navigateBack()
        Uses the navigation strategy dictated by team color to navigate back to the starting point.

      • navToObjectiveByZip

        Navigates to the objective using the zip line.

        Navigates to the objective using the shallow crossing.

        Navigates back to the start using the zip line.

      • navBackByCrossing

        private void navBackByCrossing()
        Navigates back to the start using the shallow crossing.

      • travelTo

        private void travelTo(double x,
                      double y,
                      boolean localize)
        This method divides the given path in shorter paths where the robot will localize after reaching the end of each shorter path. This method calls itself recursively until the original x and y are reached.
        Parameters:
        x - destination-x, in cm
        y - destination-y, in cm
        localize - indicates whether the robot is allowed to localize during travel to operation

      • getZipLineEndpoints

        public static int[] getZipLineEndpoints(int z0_x,
                                        int z0_y,
                                        int zC_x,
                                        int zC_y)
        This method returns, in an array of integers, the waypoints at the end of the zipline. The array is structured as follows: 
         Index   Value
 0       x of zip line end point
 1       y of zip line end point
 2       x of "other" end point
 3       y of "other" end point
        Parameters:
        z0_x - x of "other" start point.
        z0_y - y of "other" start point.
        zC_x - x of zip line start point.
        zC_y - y of zip line start point.
        Returns:
        int array containing zip line endpoints

      • findClosestCorner

        private int findClosestCorner(int[][] rectArea)
        Finds the closest corner to the robot's current position of a rectangular area.
        Parameters:
        an - array containing 4 points following the structure outlined in Helper.convertToFourCorners(int, int, int, int)
        Returns:
        the index of the closest point

      • findStart

        private double[] findStart()
        This method returns the coordinates of the starting point
        Returns:
        an array containing the coordinates. x at i = 0, y at i = 1.

      • getCrossingPath

        private double[][] getCrossingPath()
        Computes the 3-waypoints path to be taken in order to successfully cross the shallow crossing. The robot will buzz if it detects inconsistencies in the definition of the zones and of the crossing (eg.: if the crossing does not start where a navigable zone ends).
        Returns:
        the path to follow on the crossing in a bidiemnsional array path[i][j] where i is the waypoint number and j, x or y.

      • localizeBeforeCrossing

        private void localizeBeforeCrossing(double[][] path)
        Performs a light localization before crossing the bridge. The method will compute the point around which it should localize using the path provided.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to follow whilst on the crossing. This array should be generated using getCrossingPath().

      • clearCrossing

        private void clearCrossing(double[][] path)
